reviews.review: 75% of the time, you will not be playing a 'game' as it is not up to you. Between campers, sluggers, report button that does absolutely nothing and hackers, you are caught in the middle of "How much time will I waste on this?" with a developer team that say, "Oh if this is happening to you, just go play another game." Or, "If the killer is camping, just go complete the objective." Acting completely oblivious to their own problems as they try to push out DLC after DLC (That you have to pay for, btw). Do not pay for, I promise you'll be much happier for it.

Like every game it has it ups and downs, but over all this is surely one of my favourite games ever, I work and study at uni so I have very limited time and energy to play games but with this it's just so easy to jump in whenever I can and play a couple of rounds. As a horror enthusiast this game just hits a sweet spot for me, classic horror icons and new just as lovely original characters makes this game interesting in that aspect as well.

Of course it can be very frustrating with toxic players (on both sides), but that's something that is experienced in most multiplayer games. I'd say 9 out of 10 games have friendly players in my experience (that is if they say anything at all lol).

The only thing I find annoying with this game is the grind to unlock perks, which I hope they'll figure out.

Your enjoyment of this game is determined entirely by a Menu option. Survivor is overpowered while Killer is for masochists only. I'm tired of being flash-light juggled and just struggling to keep up with the game. I've been a horror fan for a long time and love to see these franchises but it's just miserable to play most of the time. Between the toxic players everywhere and the choice between getting enjoying the game but getting long cue times or short cue times with little joy to be found...

That being said, it has wonderful potential but sadly the Devs are kind of Lazy. When they put out content, it's usually pretty good these days but god does it take forever. 

Complaints aside, I'll see you on the servers. This is a love-hate relationship and it's definitely a game that I own. I've already dug my grave here so I'll stay here,

After playing many hours of DBD, I've finally pinpointed my stance on if i recommend it or not, and as you can probably already see, I do. DBD is one of those games you gain a toxic addiction for, like Tarkov. Its a game that makes you really upset at the players, the game, and yourself. The wins however, give you just enough dopamine to set aside that previous anger and start anew. I mostly enjoy playing killer, even though it makes me more angry than playing survivor. The survivor's are usually toxic and loop constantly (which is exploitation, if you didn't know). The perks killers and survivors use are not 100% balanced for each, but if able to adapt, wont be an issue for gameplay. Its a game that, although has many DLCs, makes them all worth while if you decide to get one you really like and think you'll use frequently. The game is constantly updating which shows that the game isnt done. All in all, at the end of the day, when the anger you've had for most matches are subdued, its an excellent game to play. Really is a time consumer and better with friends. I think anyone who enjoys a good horror based, survive with a team type game would really get a kick out of this.
